00010 #ifndef BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_ANON_CONT_ER_2010_HPP
00011 #define BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_ANON_CONT_ER_2010_HPP
00012 #include <deque>

00014 #include <boost/range/begin.hpp>
00015 #include <boost/range/end.hpp>
00016 #include <boost/range/size.hpp>
00017 #include <boost/range/size_type.hpp>
00018 #include <boost/range/iterator_range.hpp> //iterator_range_detail::
00019 #include <boost/assign/v2/put/put.hpp>
00020 #include <boost/assign/v2/put/range/range.hpp>
00021 #include <boost/assign/v2/put/generic/result_of_modulo.hpp>
00022 #include <boost/assign/v2/put/generic/crtp.hpp>
00023 #include <boost/assign/v2/detail/relational_op/relational_op.hpp>

00025 namespace boost{
00026 namespace assign{
00027 namespace v2{
00028 namespace anon_aux{
00029 
00030         template<typename T,typename F,typename Tag> class cont;
00031 
00032 }// anon_aux
00033 namespace result_of_modulo{
00034         
00035     template<typename T,typename F,typename Tag>
00036     struct new_fun<anon_aux::cont<T,F,Tag> >
00037     {
00038 
00039         template<typename F1>
00040         struct apply{ typedef anon_aux::cont<T, F1, Tag> type; };
00041         
00042     };
00043 
00044     template<typename T,typename F,typename Tag>
00045     struct new_modifier<anon_aux::cont<T,F,Tag> >
00046     {
00047 
00048         template<typename NewTag>
00049         struct apply{ typedef anon_aux::cont<T, F, NewTag> type; };
00050         
00051     };
00052     
00053 }//result_of_modulo
00054 namespace anon_aux{
00055 
00056         template<typename T>
00057     struct impl{ typedef std::deque<T> type; };
00058 
00059         template<typename T,typename F,typename Tag>
00060     struct cont_modifier_traits
00061     { };
00062 
00063 
00064         template<typename T,typename F,typename Tag>
00065         class cont : 
00066         public relational_op_aux::crtp< cont<T,F,Tag> >,
00067         public put_aux::crtp< 
00068                 typename anon_aux::impl<T>::type, F, Tag,
00069             cont<T,F,Tag>,
00070             cont_modifier_traits<T,F,Tag> 
00071         >
00072     {
00073         typedef typename anon_aux::impl<T>::type impl_;
00074         typedef cont_modifier_traits<T,F,Tag> modifier_traits_;
00075         typedef put_aux::crtp< impl_, F, Tag, cont, modifier_traits_> put_crtp_;
00076     
00077                 typedef put_aux::modifier<Tag> modifier_;
00078     
00079         public:
00080     
00081         typedef T value_type;
00082         typedef typename boost::range_size<impl_>::type size_type;
00083                 typedef typename boost::range_iterator<impl_>::type iterator;
00084         typedef typename boost::range_iterator<
00085                 const impl_>::type const_iterator;
00086 
00087                 // Construct
00088         cont(){}
00089         explicit cont(const F& f) : put_crtp_( f ){}
00090         explicit cont(impl_ const& v, F const& f): put_crtp_( f ), impl( v )
00091         {
00092                 // Required by crtp when Tag or F is modified.
00093         }
00094 
00095                 explicit cont( impl_ const& v, F const& f, modifier_ const& m ) 
00096                 : put_crtp_( f, m ), impl( v )
00097         {
00098                 // Required by crtp when Tag or F is modified.
00099         }
00100         
00101         // Deque interface
00102                 iterator begin(){ 
00103                 return boost::begin( this->impl ); 
00104         }
00105                 iterator end(){ 
00106                 return boost::end( this->impl ); 
00107         }
00108                 const_iterator begin()const{ 
00109                 return boost::begin( this->impl ); 
00110         }
00111                 const_iterator end()const{ 
00112                 return boost::end( this->impl ); 
00113         }
00114 
00115                 typedef typename impl_::reference reference;
00116                 typedef typename impl_::const_reference const_reference;
00117                 typedef typename impl_::difference_type difference_type;
00118 
00119                 size_type size()const{ 
00120                 return this->unwrap().size(); 
00121         }
00122                 size_type max_size()const{ 
00123                 return this->unwrap().max_size(); 
00124         }
00125                 bool empty()const{ 
00126                 return this->unwrap().empty(); 
00127         }
00128                 reference operator[](size_type n){ 
00129                 return this->unwrap()[n]; 
00130         }
00131                 const_reference operator[](size_type n)const{ 
00132                 return this->unwrap()[n]; 
00133         }
00134                 reference front(){ 
00135                 return this->unwrap().front(); 
00136         }
00137                 const_reference front()const{ 
00138                 return this->unwrap().front(); 
00139         }
00140                 reference back(){ 
00141                 return this->unwrap().back(); 
00142         }
00143                 const_reference back()const{ 
00144                 return this->unwrap().back(); 
00145         }
00146                 void pop_front(){ 
00147                 this->unwrap().pop_front(); 
00148         }
00149                 void pop_back(){ 
00150                 this->unwrap().pop_back(); 
00151         }
00152                 void swap(cont& that){ 
00153                 this->unwrap().swap( that.unwrap() ); 
00154         }
00155 
00156                 // Note : the modifiers such as push_back() are ommitted as they 
00157         // accessible through the put interface.
00158 
00159                 // Convert
00160 
00161                 BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_CONVERT_CONVERT_MF
00162                 BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_CONVERT_OPERATOR_MF
00163 
00164                 impl_& unwrap()const{ return this->impl; }
00165         
00166         // Relational op
00167 
00168                 template<typename R>
00169         bool equal_to(const R& r)const{
00170                 return ::boost::iterator_range_detail::equal( 
00171                 (*this), r );
00172                 }
00173 
00174                 template<typename R>
00175         bool less_than(const R& r)const{
00176                 return ::boost::iterator_range_detail::less_than( 
00177                 (*this), r );
00178                 }
00179 
00180         protected:
00181         mutable impl_ impl;
00182                 
00183     };
00184 
00185 }// anon_aux
00186 }// v2
00187 }// assign
00188 }// boost

00190 #endif
